column1: The Purple Pig////Be prepared to get cozy with your newfound friends (the complete strangers joining you at communal tables) because this place is popular and relatively small
column2: so they pack folks in. We wandered in midday on a Sunday
column3: and it was busy but there was no wait whatsoever. I guess we got lucky to get no reservation and no wait time. Service was incredibly friendly and prompt. All of the menu items are quite large
column4: so go with a group and eat family style so you can sample more items because everything is great and there are a lot of options. This is a meat-lover's dream. Also
